title: 112_s1484
content: The Act is titled the "Hyde and Related Amendments Codification Act" and it prohibits taxpayer-funded abortions while providing conscience protections in a new chapter added to Title 1 of the United States Code. The "Hyde and Related Amendments Codification Act" includes provisions such as prohibiting funding for abortions, health benefits plans covering abortion, limitations on Federal facilities and employees, and treatment of abortions related to rape, incest, or preserving the life of the mother. The "Hyde and Related Amendments Codification Act" prohibits the use of federal funds for abortions and health benefits plans that cover abortion. The text chunk discusses limitations on federal facilities and employees providing abortion services, as well as the allowance for individuals, entities, or states to purchase separate abortion coverage or health benefits that include abortion. The text chunk allows for non-Federal funds to be used for abortion coverage, without restrictions, as long as the funds are not from Federal sources. It also permits states or localities to contract with providers for abortion coverage separately. It also permits states or localities to contract with providers for abortion coverage separately, ensuring that no other Federal laws are affected by these provisions. Sec. 307 of this chapter clarifies that complications arising from abortion are not subject to the regulations outlined. Sec. 308 exempts abortions related to rape, incest, or preserving the life of the mother from certain limitations. Sec. 309 states that the limitations on abortion do not apply in cases of rape, incest, or when the woman's life is in danger due to a physical condition. In this chapter, any funds appropriated by Federal law include amounts approved by Act of Congress for the District of Columbia. The term 'Federal Government' encompasses the government of the District of Columbia. Section 310 prohibits government discrimination against certain health care entities receiving Federal financial assistance. State or local government receiving Federal financial assistance cannot discriminate against health care entities that do not provide, pay for, cover, or refer for abortions. A health care entity includes individual physicians, hospitals, provider-sponsored organizations, health maintenance organizations, health insurance plans, and other health care facilities. The courts of the United States provide remedies for violations of this section. The courts of the United States have jurisdiction to prevent and address violations of this section by issuing legal or equitable relief, including injunctions and orders withholding Federal financial assistance until the prohibited conduct ceases. An action under this subsection may be initiated by a health care entity or the Attorney General of the United States. The Secretary of Health and Human Services designates the Director of the Office for Civil Rights to receive complaints alleging a violation of this section. The Secretary of Health and Human Services designates the Director of the Office for Civil Rights to receive complaints alleging a violation of this section and pursue investigations in coordination with the Attorney General. Complaints related to Federal agencies or programs administered by other agencies are referred to the appropriate office of that agency.
